segments.pli: Aṅguttara Nikāya 6
segments.en: Numbered Discourses 6

segments.pli: 5. Dhammikavagga
segments.en: 5. About Dhammika

segments.pli: 53. Appamādasutta
segments.en: 53. Diligence

segments.pli: Atha kho aññataro brāhmaṇo yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhiṃ sammodi.
segments.en: Then a certain brahmin went up to the Buddha, and exchanged greetings with him.

segments.pli: Sammodanīyaṃ kathaṃ sāraṇīyaṃ vītisāretvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho so brāhmaṇo bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, he sat down to one side and said to the Buddha:

segments.pli: “Atthi nu kho, bho gotama, eko dhammo bhāvito bahulīkato yo ubho atthe samadhiggayha tiṭṭhati—diṭṭhadhammikañceva atthaṃ, yo ca attho samparāyiko”ti?
segments.en: “Master Gotama, is there one thing that, when developed and cultivated, secures benefits for both the present life and lives to come?”

segments.pli: “Atthi kho, brāhmaṇa, eko dhammo bhāvito bahulīkato yo ubho atthe samadhiggayha tiṭṭhati—diṭṭhadhammikañceva atthaṃ, yo ca attho samparāyiko”ti.
segments.en: “There is, brahmin.”

segments.pli: “Katamo pana, bho gotama, eko dhammo bhāvito bahulīkato yo ubho atthe samadhiggayha tiṭṭhati—diṭṭhadhammikañceva atthaṃ, yo ca attho samparāyiko”ti?
segments.en: “So what is it?”

segments.pli: “Appamādo kho, brāhmaṇa, eko dhammo bhāvito bahulīkato ubho atthe samadhiggayha tiṭṭhati—diṭṭhadhammikañceva atthaṃ, yo ca attho samparāyiko.
segments.en: “Diligence, brahmin, is one thing that, when developed and cultivated, secures benefits for both the present life and lives to come.

segments.pli: Seyyathāpi, brāhmaṇa, yāni kānici jaṅgalānaṃ pāṇānaṃ padajātāni, sabbāni tāni hatthipade samodhānaṃ gacchanti; hatthipadaṃ tesaṃ aggamakkhāyati, yadidaṃ mahantattena.
segments.en: The footprints of all creatures that walk can fit inside an elephant’s footprint. So an elephant’s footprint is said to be the biggest of them all.

segments.pli: Evamevaṃ kho, brāhmaṇa, appamādo eko dhammo bhāvito bahulīkato ubho atthe samadhiggayha tiṭṭhati—diṭṭhadhammikañceva atthaṃ, yo ca attho samparāyiko. (1)
segments.en: In the same way, diligence is one thing that, when developed and cultivated, secures benefits for both the present life and lives to come.

segments.pli: Seyyathāpi, brāhmaṇa, kūṭāgārassa yā kāci gopānasiyo sabbā tā kūṭaṅgamā kūṭaninnā kūṭasamosaraṇā, kūṭaṃ tāsaṃ aggamakkhāyati;
segments.en: The rafters of a bungalow all lean to the peak, slope to the peak, and meet at the peak, so the peak is said to be the topmost of them all.

segments.pli: evamevaṃ kho, brāhmaṇa … pe …. (2)
segments.en: In the same way, diligence is one thing …

segments.pli: Seyyathāpi, brāhmaṇa, pabbajalāyako pabbajaṃ lāyitvā agge gahetvā odhunāti nidhunāti nicchādeti;
segments.en: A reed-cutter, having cut the reeds, grabs them at the top and shakes them down, shakes them about, and shakes them off.

segments.pli: evamevaṃ kho, brāhmaṇa … pe …. (3)
segments.en: In the same way, diligence is one thing …

segments.pli: Seyyathāpi, brāhmaṇa, ambapiṇḍiyā vaṇṭacchinnāya yāni kānici ambāni vaṇṭūpanibandhanāni sabbāni tāni tadanvayāni bhavanti;
segments.en: When the stalk of a bunch of mangoes is cut, all the mangoes attached to the stalk will follow along.

segments.pli: evamevaṃ kho, brāhmaṇa … pe …. (4)
segments.en: In the same way, diligence is one thing …

segments.pli: Seyyathāpi, brāhmaṇa, ye keci khuddarājāno sabbete rañño cakkavattissa anuyantā bhavanti, rājā tesaṃ cakkavattī aggamakkhāyati;
segments.en: All lesser rulers are vassals of a wheel-turning monarch, so the wheel-turning monarch is said to be the foremost of them all.

segments.pli: evamevaṃ kho, brāhmaṇa … pe …. (5)
segments.en: In the same way, diligence is one thing …

segments.pli: Seyyathāpi, brāhmaṇa, yā kāci tārakarūpānaṃ pabhā sabbā tā candassa pabhāya kalaṃ nāgghanti soḷasiṃ, candappabhā tāsaṃ aggamakkhāyati;
segments.en: The radiance of all the stars is not worth a sixteenth part of the moon’s radiance, so the moon’s radiance is said to be the best of them all.

segments.pli: evamevaṃ kho, brāhmaṇa, appamādo eko dhammo bhāvito bahulīkato ubho atthe samadhiggayha tiṭṭhati—diṭṭhadhammikañceva atthaṃ yo ca attho samparāyiko. (6)
segments.en: In the same way, diligence is one thing that, when developed and cultivated, secures benefits for both the present life and lives to come.

segments.pli: Ayaṃ kho, brāhmaṇa, eko dhammo bhāvito bahulīkato ubho atthe samadhiggayha tiṭṭhati—diṭṭhadhammikañceva atthaṃ, yo ca attho samparāyiko”ti.
segments.en: This is the one thing that, when developed and cultivated, secures benefits for both the present life and lives to come.”

segments.pli: “Abhikkantaṃ, bho gotama, abhikkantaṃ, bho gotama … pe …
segments.en: “Excellent, Master Gotama! Excellent! …

segments.pli: upāsakaṃ maṃ bhavaṃ gotamo dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetaṃ saraṇaṃ gatan”ti.
segments.en: From this day forth, may Master Gotama remember me as a lay follower who has gone for refuge for life.”

segments.pli: Ekādasamaṃ.

sections.title: Then a certain brahmin went up to the Buddha,…

suttaplex.blurb: With a series of vivid similes, the Buddha shows how diligence leads to benefits in both this life and the next.
